messages.name: BaseOrder
messages.description:
BaseOrder defines a base order type. It contains all the necessary fields for
specifying the general details about a buy, sell, or swap order.

messages.name: Batch
messages.description:
Batch holds a collection of outstanding buy, sell, and swap orders on a
particular bond.

messages.name: Bond
messages.description: Bond defines a token bonding curve type with all of its parameters.

messages.name: BondDetails
messages.description: BondDetails contains details about the current state of a given bond.

messages.name: BuyOrder
messages.description:
BuyOrder defines a type for submitting a buy order on a bond, together with
the maximum amount of reserve tokens the buyer is willing to pay.

messages.name: FunctionParam
messages.description:
FunctionParam is a key-value pair used for specifying a specific bond
parameter.

messages.name: Params
messages.description: Params defines the parameters for the bonds module.

messages.name: SellOrder
messages.description: SellOrder defines a type for submitting a sell order on a bond.

messages.name: SwapOrder
messages.description:
SwapOrder defines a type for submitting a swap order between two tokens on a
bond.

messages.name: BondBuyOrderCancelledEvent
messages.description:
BondBuyOrderCancelledEvent is an event triggered on a Bond buy order
cancellation

messages.name: BondBuyOrderEvent
messages.description: BondBuyOrderEvent is an event triggered on a Bond buy order

messages.name: BondBuyOrderFulfilledEvent
messages.description:
BondBuyOrderFulfilledEvent is an event triggered on a Bond buy order
fullfillment

messages.name: BondCreatedEvent
messages.description: BondCreatedEvent is an event triggered on a Bond creation

messages.name: BondEditAlphaFailedEvent
messages.description:
BondEditAlphaFailedEvent is an event triggered on a failed attempt to edit of
Bond alpha value

messages.name: BondEditAlphaSuccessEvent
messages.description:
BondEditAlphaSuccessEvent is an event triggered on a successful edit of Bond
alpha value

messages.name: BondMakeOutcomePaymentEvent
messages.description:
BondMakeOutcomePaymentEvent is an event triggered on a Bond make outcome
payment

messages.name: BondSellOrderEvent
messages.description: BondSellOrderEvent is an event triggered on a Bond sell order

messages.name: BondSellOrderFulfilledEvent
messages.description:
BondSellOrderFulfilledEvent is an event triggered on a Bond sell order
fullfillment

messages.name: BondSetNextAlphaEvent
messages.description: BondSetNextAlphaEvent is an event triggered when next batch alpha is set

messages.name: BondSwapOrderEvent
messages.description: BondSwapOrderEvent is an event triggered on a Bond swap order

messages.name: BondSwapOrderFulfilledEvent
messages.description:
BondSwapOrderFulfilledEvent is an event triggered on a Bond swap order
fullfillment

messages.name: BondUpdatedEvent
messages.description: BondUpdatedEvent is an event triggered on a Bond update

messages.name: BondWithdrawReserveEvent
messages.description: BondWithdrawReserveEvent is an event triggered on a Bond reserve withdrawal

messages.name: BondWithdrawShareEvent
messages.description: BondWithdrawShareEvent is an event triggered on a Bond share withdrawal

messages.name: GenesisState
messages.description: GenesisState defines the bonds module's genesis state.

services.name: Query
services.description: Query defines the gRPC querier service.

methods.name: Bonds
methods.description: Bonds returns all existing bonds.

methods.name: BondsDetailed
methods.description:
BondsDetailed returns a list of all existing bonds with some details about
their current state.

methods.name: Params
methods.description: Params queries the parameters of x/bonds module.

methods.name: Bond
methods.description: Bond queries info of a specific bond.

methods.name: Batch
methods.description: Batch queries info of a specific bond's current batch.

methods.name: LastBatch
methods.description: LastBatch queries info of a specific bond's last batch.

methods.name: CurrentPrice
methods.description: CurrentPrice queries the current price/s of a specific bond.

methods.name: CurrentReserve
methods.description:
CurrentReserve queries the current balance/s of the reserve pool for a
specific bond.

methods.name: AvailableReserve
methods.description:
AvailableReserve queries current available balance/s of the reserve pool
for a specific bond.

methods.name: CustomPrice
methods.description: CustomPrice queries price/s of a specific bond at a specific supply.

methods.name: BuyPrice
methods.description:
BuyPrice queries price/s of buying an amount of tokens from a specific
bond.

methods.name: SellReturn
methods.description:
SellReturn queries return/s on selling an amount of tokens of a specific
bond.

methods.name: SwapReturn
methods.description:
SwapReturn queries return/s on swapping an amount of tokens to another
token of a specific bond.

methods.name: AlphaMaximums
methods.description:
AlphaMaximums queries alpha maximums for a specific augmented bonding
curve.

messages.name: MsgBuy
messages.description: MsgBuy defines a message for buying from a bond.

messages.name: MsgBuyResponse
messages.description: MsgBuyResponse defines the Msg/Buy response type.

messages.name: MsgCreateBond
messages.description: MsgCreateBond defines a message for creating a new bond.

messages.name: MsgCreateBondResponse
messages.description: MsgCreateBondResponse defines the Msg/CreateBond response type.

messages.name: MsgEditBond
messages.description: MsgEditBond defines a message for editing an existing bond.

messages.name: MsgEditBondResponse
messages.description: MsgEditBondResponse defines the Msg/EditBond response type.

messages.name: MsgMakeOutcomePayment
messages.description:
MsgMakeOutcomePayment defines a message for making an outcome payment to a
bond.

messages.name: MsgMakeOutcomePaymentResponse
messages.description:
MsgMakeOutcomePaymentResponse defines the Msg/MakeOutcomePayment response
type.

messages.name: MsgSell
messages.description: MsgSell defines a message for selling from a bond.

messages.name: MsgSellResponse
messages.description: MsgSellResponse defines the Msg/Sell response type.

messages.name: MsgSetNextAlpha
messages.description: MsgSetNextAlpha defines a message for editing a bond's alpha parameter.

messages.name: MsgSwap
messages.description:
MsgSwap defines a message for swapping from one reserve bond token to
another.

messages.name: MsgSwapResponse
messages.description: MsgSwapResponse defines the Msg/Swap response type.

messages.name: MsgUpdateBondState
messages.description: MsgUpdateBondState defines a message for updating a bond's current state.

messages.name: MsgUpdateBondStateResponse
messages.description: MsgUpdateBondStateResponse defines the Msg/UpdateBondState response type.

messages.name: MsgWithdrawReserve
messages.description: MsgWithdrawReserve defines a message for withdrawing reserve from a bond.

messages.name: MsgWithdrawReserveResponse
messages.description: MsgWithdrawReserveResponse defines the Msg/WithdrawReserve response type.

messages.name: MsgWithdrawShare
messages.description:
MsgWithdrawShare defines a message for withdrawing a share from a bond that
is in the SETTLE stage.

messages.name: MsgWithdrawShareResponse
messages.description: MsgWithdrawShareResponse defines the Msg/WithdrawShare response type.

services.name: Msg
services.description: Msg defines the bonds Msg service.

methods.name: CreateBond
methods.description: CreateBond defines a method for creating a bond.

methods.name: EditBond
methods.description: EditBond defines a method for editing a bond.

methods.name: SetNextAlpha
methods.description: SetNextAlpha defines a method for editing a bond's alpha parameter.

methods.name: UpdateBondState
methods.description: UpdateBondState defines a method for updating a bond's current state.

methods.name: Buy
methods.description: Buy defines a method for buying from a bond.

methods.name: Sell
methods.description: Sell defines a method for selling from a bond.

methods.name: Swap
methods.description: Swap defines a method for swapping from one reserve bond token to another.

methods.name: MakeOutcomePayment
methods.description:
MakeOutcomePayment defines a method for making an outcome payment to a
bond.

methods.name: WithdrawShare
methods.description:
WithdrawShare defines a method for withdrawing a share from a bond that is
in the SETTLE stage.

methods.name: WithdrawReserve
methods.description: WithdrawReserve defines a method for withdrawing reserve from a bond.

values.name: PROMISED
values.description: agent is contracted to receive payment

values.name: GUARANTEED
values.description: escrow set up with funds blocked

fields.name: amount
fields.description:
chose uint64 for now as amounts should be small enough to fit in a
uint64(max 18446744073709551615)

fields.name: collection_id
fields.description: collection_id indicates to which Collection this claim belongs

fields.name: agent_did
fields.description: agent is the DID of the agent submitting the claim

fields.name: submission_date
fields.description: submissionDate is the date and time that the claim was submitted on-chain

fields.name: claim_id
fields.description: claimID is the unique identifier of the claim in the cid hash format

fields.name: evaluation
fields.description: evaluation is the result of one or more claim evaluations

fields.name: rejection
fields.description: PaymentStatus penalty = 5;

fields.name: id
fields.description: collection id is the incremented internal id for the collection of claims

fields.name: entity
fields.description: entity is the DID of the entity for which the claims are being created

fields.name: admin
fields.description:
admin is the account address that will authorize or revoke agents and
payments (the grantor), and can update the collection

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: protocol is the DID of the claim protocol

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: startDate is the date after which claims may be submitted

fields.name: end_date
fields.description:
endDate is the date after which no more claims may be submitted (no endDate
is allowed)

fields.name: quota
fields.description: quota is the maximum number of claims that may be submitted, 0 is unlimited

fields.name: count
fields.description: count is the number of claims already submitted (internally calculated)

fields.name: evaluated
fields.description:
evaluated is the number of claims that have been evaluated (internally
calculated)

fields.name: approved
fields.description:
approved is the number of claims that have been evaluated and approved
(internally calculated)

fields.name: rejected
fields.description:
rejected is the number of claims that have been evaluated and rejected
(internally calculated)

fields.name: disputed
fields.description:
disputed is the number of claims that have disputed status (internally
calculated)

fields.name: state
fields.description: state is the current state of this Collection (open, paused, closed)

fields.name: payments
fields.description:
payments is the amount paid for claim submission, evaluation, approval, or
rejection

fields.name: signer
fields.description: signer address

fields.name: invalidated
fields.description:
invalidated is the number of claims that have been evaluated as invalid
(internally calculated)

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is expressed as an integer, interpreted by the client

fields.name: uri
fields.description: dispute link ***.ipfs

fields.name: claim_id
fields.description: claim_id indicates which Claim this evaluation is for

fields.name: collection_id
fields.description:
collection_id indicates to which Collection the claim being evaluated
belongs to

fields.name: oracle
fields.description: oracle is the DID of the Oracle entity that evaluates the claim

fields.name: agent_did
fields.description: agent is the DID of the agent that submits the evaluation

fields.name: status
fields.description:
status is the evaluation status expressed as an integer (2=approved,
3=rejected, ...)

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
reason is the code expressed as an integer, for why the evaluation result
was given (codes defined by evaluator)

fields.name: verification_proof
fields.description: verificationProof is the cid of the evaluation Verfiable Credential

fields.name: evaluation_date
fields.description:
evaluationDate is the date and time that the claim evaluation was submitted
on-chain

fields.name: amount
fields.description:
custom amount specified by evaluator for claim approval, if empty list then
use default by Collection

TODO: add custom cw20 payments?
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: account
fields.description: account is the entity account address from which the payment will be made

fields.name: contract_1155_payment
fields.description: if empty(nil) then no contract payment, not allowed for Evaluation Payment

fields.name: timeout_ns
fields.description:
timeout after claim/evaluation to create authZ for payment, if 0 then
immediate direct payment

fields.name: cw20_payment
fields.description: cw20 payments, can be empty or multiple
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: rejection
fields.description: Payment penalty = 5;

fields.name: admin
fields.description: address of admin

fields.name: collection_id
fields.description: collection_id indicates to which Collection this claim belongs

fields.name: claim_ids
fields.description: either collection_id or claim_ids is needed
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: before_date
fields.description: if null then no before_date validation done

fields.name: max_custom_amount
fields.description:
max custom amount evaluator can change, if empty list must use amount
defined in Token payments
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: max_custom_cw20_payment
fields.description:
max custom cw20 payment evaluator can change, if empty list must use amount
defined in Token payments
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: admin
fields.description: address of admin

fields.name: collection_id
fields.description: collection_id indicates to which Collection this claim belongs

fields.name: admin
fields.description: address of admin

fields.name: claim_id
fields.description: claim_id the withdrawal is for

fields.name: inputs
fields.description: Inputs to the multisend tx to run to withdraw payment
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: outputs
fields.description: Outputs for the multisend tx to run to withdraw payment
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: payment_type
fields.description:
payment type to keep track what payment is for and mark claim payment
accordingly

fields.name: contract_1155_payment
fields.description: if empty(nil) then no contract payment

fields.name: toAddress
fields.description: for contract payment

fields.name: fromAddress
fields.description: for contract payment

fields.name: release_date
fields.description:
date that grantee can execute authorization, calculated from created date
plus the timeout on Collection payments, if null then none

fields.name: cw20_payment
fields.description: cw20 payments, can be empty or multiple
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: MsgDisputeClaim
messages.description:
Agent laying dispute must be admin for Collection, or controller on
Collection entity, or have authz cap, aka is agent

fields.name: subject_id
fields.description:
subject_id for which this dispute is against, for now can only lay disputes
against claims

fields.name: agent_did
fields.description:
agent is the DID of the agent disputing the claim, agent details won't be
saved in kvStore

fields.name: dispute_type
fields.description: type is expressed as an integer, interpreted by the client

fields.name: claim_id
fields.description: claimID is the unique identifier of the claim to make evaluation against

fields.name: collection_id
fields.description: collection_id indicates to which Collection this claim belongs

fields.name: oracle
fields.description: oracle is the DID of the Oracle entity that evaluates the claim

fields.name: agent_did
fields.description: agent is the DID of the agent that submits the evaluation

fields.name: admin_address
fields.description: admin address used to sign this message, validated against Collection Admin

fields.name: status
fields.description:
status is the evaluation status expressed as an integer (2=approved,
3=rejected, ...)

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
reason is the code expressed as an integer, for why the evaluation result
was given (codes defined by evaluator)

fields.name: verification_proof
fields.description: verificationProof is the cid of the evaluation Verfiable Credential

fields.name: amount
fields.description:
custom amount specified by evaluator for claim approval, if empty list then
use default by Collection

fields.name: cw20_payment
fields.description:
custom cw20 payments specified by evaluator for claim approval, if empty

messages.name: IidDocument
messages.description:
type entity account
relationship entity account

fields.name: context
fields.description: @context is spec for did document.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: id
fields.description: id represents the id for the did document.

fields.name: controller
fields.description:
A DID controller is an entity that is authorized to make changes to a DID
document. cfr. https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#did-controller
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: verificationMethod
fields.description:
A DID document can express verification methods,
such as cryptographic public keys, which can be used
to authenticate or authorize interactions with the DID subject or
associated parties. https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#verification-methods
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: service
fields.description:
Services are used in DID documents to express ways of communicating
with the DID subject or associated entities.
https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#services
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: authentication
fields.description:
NOTE: below this line there are the relationships
Authentication represents public key associated with the did document.
cfr. https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#authentication
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: assertionMethod
fields.description:
Used to specify how the DID subject is expected to express claims,
such as for the purposes of issuing a Verifiable Credential.
cfr. https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#assertion
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: keyAgreement
fields.description:
used to specify how an entity can generate encryption material
in order to transmit confidential information intended for the DID subject.
https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#key-agreement
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: capabilityInvocation
fields.description:
Used to specify a verification method that might be used by the DID subject
to invoke a cryptographic capability, such as the authorization
to update the DID Document.
https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#capability-invocation
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: capabilityDelegation
fields.description:
Used to specify a mechanism that might be used by the DID subject
to delegate a cryptographic capability to another party.
https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#capability-delegation
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
Metadata concerning the IidDocument such as versionId, created, updated and
deactivated

fields.name: id
fields.description: id represents the id for the entity document.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of entity, eg protocol or asset

fields.name: start_date
fields.description:
Start Date of the Entity as defined by the implementer and interpreted by
Client applications

fields.name: end_date
fields.description:
End Date of the Entity as defined by the implementer and interpreted by
Client applications

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Status of the Entity as defined by the implementer and interpreted by
Client applications

fields.name: relayer_node
fields.description: Did of the operator through which the Entity was created

fields.name: credentials
fields.description: Credentials of the entity to be verified
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: entity_verified
fields.description: Used as check whether the credentials of entity is verified

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
Metadata concerning the Entity such as versionId, created, updated and
deactivated

fields.name: accounts
fields.description: module accounts created for entity
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: EpochInfo
messages.description:
EpochInfo is a struct that describes the data going into
a timer defined by the x/epochs module.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: identifier is a unique reference to this particular timer.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description:
start_time is the time at which the timer first ever ticks.
If start_time is in the future, the epoch will not begin until the start
time.

fields.name: duration
fields.description:
duration is the time in between epoch ticks.
In order for intended behavior to be met, duration should
be greater than the chains expected block time.
Duration must be non-zero.

fields.name: current_epoch
fields.description:
current_epoch is the current epoch number, or in other words,
how many times has the timer 'ticked'.
The first tick (current_epoch=1) is defined as
the first block whose blocktime is greater than the EpochInfo start_time.

fields.name: current_epoch_start_time
fields.description:
current_epoch_start_time describes the start time of the current timer
interval. The interval is (current_epoch_start_time,
current_epoch_start_time + duration] When the timer ticks, this is set to
current_epoch_start_time = last_epoch_start_time + duration only one timer
tick for a given identifier can occur per block.

NOTE! The current_epoch_start_time may diverge significantly from the
wall-clock time the epoch began at. Wall-clock time of epoch start may be
>> current_epoch_start_time. Suppose current_epoch_start_time = 10,
duration = 5. Suppose the chain goes offline at t=14, and comes back online
at t=30, and produces blocks at every successive time. (t=31, 32, etc.)
* The t=30 block will start the epoch for (10, 15]
* The t=31 block will start the epoch for (15, 20]
* The t=32 block will start the epoch for (20, 25]
* The t=33 block will start the epoch for (25, 30]
* The t=34 block will start the epoch for (30, 35]
* The **t=36** block will start the epoch for (35, 40]

fields.name: epoch_counting_started
fields.description:
epoch_counting_started is a boolean, that indicates whether this
epoch timer has began yet.

fields.name: current_epoch_start_height
fields.description:
current_epoch_start_height is the block height at which the current epoch
started. (The block height at which the timer last ticked)

fields.name: epoch_number
fields.description: Epoch number, starting from 1.

fields.name: epoch_number
fields.description: Epoch number, starting from 1.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: The start timestamp of the epoch.

messages.name: DistributionProportions
messages.description:
DistributionProportions defines the distribution proportions of the minted
denom. In other words, defines which stakeholders will receive the minted
denoms and how much.

fields.name: staking
fields.description:
staking defines the proportion of the minted mint_denom that is to be
allocated as staking rewards.

fields.name: impact_rewards
fields.description:
impact_rewards defines the proportion of the minted mint_denom that is
to be allocated to impact rewards addresses.

fields.name: community_pool
fields.description:
community_pool defines the proportion of the minted mint_denom that is
to be allocated to the community pool.

messages.name: Minter
messages.description: Minter represents the minting state.

fields.name: epoch_provisions
fields.description: epoch_provisions represent rewards for the current epoch.

messages.name: Params
messages.description: Params holds parameters for the x/mint module.

fields.name: mint_denom
fields.description: mint_denom is the denom of the coin to mint.

fields.name: genesis_epoch_provisions
fields.description: genesis_epoch_provisions epoch provisions from the first epoch.

fields.name: epoch_identifier
fields.description: epoch_identifier mint epoch identifier e.g. (day, week).

fields.name: reduction_period_in_epochs
fields.description:
reduction_period_in_epochs the number of epochs it takes
to reduce the rewards.

fields.name: reduction_factor
fields.description:
reduction_factor is the reduction multiplier to execute
at the end of each period set by reduction_period_in_epochs.

fields.name: distribution_proportions
fields.description:
distribution_proportions defines the distribution proportions of the minted
denom. In other words, defines which stakeholders will receive the minted
denoms and how much.

fields.name: weighted_impact_rewards_receivers
fields.description:
weighted_impact_rewards_receivers is the address to receive impact
rewards with weights assigned to each address. The final amount that each
address receives is: epoch_provisions *
distribution_proportions.impact_rewards * Address's Weight.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: minting_rewards_distribution_start_epoch
fields.description:
minting_rewards_distribution_start_epoch start epoch to distribute minting
rewards

messages.name: WeightedAddress
messages.description:
WeightedAddress represents an address with a weight assigned to it.
The weight is used to determine the proportion of the total minted
tokens to be minted to the address.

messages.name: GenesisState
messages.description: GenesisState defines the mint module's genesis state.

fields.name: minter
fields.description: minter is an abstraction for holding current rewards information.

fields.name: params
fields.description: params defines all the parameters of the mint module.

fields.name: reduction_started_epoch
fields.description:
reduction_started_epoch is the first epoch in which the reduction of mint
begins.

tokenData is the linkedResources added to tokenMetadata when queried eg

tokens.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: address of owner

fields.name: tokens
fields.description: tokens to retire, all tokens must be in same smart contract
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: jurisdiction
fields.description:
jurisdiction is the jurisdiction of the token owner. A jurisdiction has
the format: <country-code>[-<sub-national-code>[ <postal-code>]]
The country-code must be 2 alphabetic characters, the sub-national-code
can be 1-3 alphanumeric characters, and the postal-code can be up to 64
alphanumeric characters. Only the country-code is required, while the
sub-national-code and postal-code are optional and can be added for
increased precision. See the valid format for this below.

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
reason is any arbitrary string that specifies the reason for retiring
tokens.

fields.description: address of minter

fields.name: recipient
fields.description: address of receiver

fields.name: tokens
fields.description: all tokens must be in same smart contract
fields.label: repeated

fields.description: id that identifies the token

fields.name: amount
fields.description: amount is the number of tokens to transfer

messages.name: Params
messages.description: Params defines the parameters for the module.

fields.name: maximum_unauthenticated_gas
fields.description:
MaximumUnauthenticatedGas defines the maximum amount of gas that can be
used to authenticate a transaction in ante handler without having fee payer
authenticated.

fields.name: is_smart_account_active
fields.description:
IsSmartAccountActive defines the state of the authenticator.
If set to false, the authenticator module will not be used
and the classic cosmos sdk authentication will be used instead.

fields.name: circuit_breaker_controllers
fields.description:
CircuitBreakerControllers defines list of addresses that are allowed to
set is_smart_account_active without going through governance.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: AccountAuthenticator
messages.description:
AccountAuthenticator represents a foundational model for all authenticators.
It provides extensibility by allowing concrete types to interpret and
validate transactions based on the encapsulated data.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID uniquely identifies the authenticator instance.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type specifies the category of the AccountAuthenticator.
This type information is essential for differentiating authenticators
and ensuring precise data retrieval from the storage layer.

fields.name: config
fields.description:
Config is a versatile field used in conjunction with the specific type of
account authenticator to facilitate complex authentication processes.
The interpretation of this field is overloaded, enabling multiple
authenticators to utilize it for their respective purposes.

messages.name: AuthenticatorData
messages.description:
AuthenticatorData represents a genesis exported account with Authenticators.
The address is used as the key, and the account authenticators are stored in
the authenticators field.

fields.name: address
fields.description: address is an account address, one address can have many authenticators

fields.name: authenticators
fields.description:
authenticators are the account's authenticators, these can be multiple
types including SignatureVerification, AllOfs, CosmWasmAuthenticators, etc
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: GenesisState
messages.description: GenesisState defines the authenticator module's genesis state.

fields.name: params
fields.description: params define the parameters for the authenticator module.

fields.name: next_authenticator_id
fields.description: next_authenticator_id is the next available authenticator ID.

fields.name: authenticator_data
fields.description:
authenticator_data contains the data for multiple accounts, each with their
authenticators.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: selected_authenticators
fields.description:
selected_authenticators holds the authenticator_id for the chosen
authenticator per message.
fields.label: repeated

methods.name: SetActiveState
methods.description:
SetActiveState sets the active state of the authenticator.
Primarily used for circuit breaking.

fields.name: minter
fields.description: address of minter

fields.name: name
fields.description:
name is the token name, which must be unique (namespace), will be verified
against Token name provided on msgCreateToken

fields.name: index
fields.description: index is the unique identifier hexstring that identifies the token

fields.name: collection
fields.description: did of collection (eg Supamoto Malawi)

fields.name: tokenData
fields.description:
tokenData is the linkedResources added to tokenMetadata when queried eg
(credential link ***.ipfs)
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: TokenCancelledEvent
messages.description: TokenCancelledEvent is an event triggered on a Token cancel execution

fields.name: owner
fields.description: the token owner

messages.name: TokenCreatedEvent
messages.description: TokenCreatedEvent is an event triggered on a Token creation

messages.name: TokenMintedEvent
messages.description: TokenMintedEvent is an event triggered on a Token mint execution

fields.name: contract_address
fields.description: the contract address of token contract being initialized

fields.name: minter
fields.description: the token minter

fields.name: owner
fields.description: the new tokens owner

messages.name: TokenPausedEvent
messages.description: TokenPausedEvent is an event triggered on a Token pause/unpause execution

fields.name: minter
fields.description: the minter address

messages.name: TokenRetiredEvent
messages.description: TokenRetiredEvent is an event triggered on a Token retire execution

fields.name: owner
fields.description: the token owner

messages.name: TokenStoppedEvent
messages.description: TokenStoppedEvent is an event triggered on a Token stopped execution

fields.name: minter
fields.description: the minter address

messages.name: TokenTransferredEvent
messages.description: TokenTransferedEvent is an event triggered on a Token transfer execution

fields.name: owner
fields.description: the old token owner

fields.name: recipient
fields.description: the new tokens owner

messages.name: TokenUpdatedEvent
messages.description: TokenUpdatedEvent is an event triggered on a Token update

messages.name: GenesisState
messages.description: GenesisState defines the module's genesis state.

fields.name: params
fields.description: params holds all the parameters of this module.

fields.name: minter
fields.description: minter address to get Token Doc for

fields.name: minter
fields.description: minter address to get list for

services.name: Query
services.description: Query defines the gRPC querier service.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
